description:
Immunohistochemistry (IHC) is a method that combines biochemical, histological and immunological techniques into a simple but powerful assay for protein detection. IHC provides valuable information as it visualizes the distribution and localization of specific cellular components within cells and in proper tissue context.

 

This protocol describes the steps for performing the immunohistochemistry method with paraffin-embedded tissue sections.
keywords: ihc, immunohistochemistry, immunostaining, ihc-p, paraffin embedded
guidelines: Tissue preparation is a key to successful IHC experiments. Since no universal tissue preparation method will be ideal for all sample and tissue types, the protocol given here is intended as a starting point from which the experimenter must optimize as needed. All conditions should be standardized in order to ensure reproducible results. Keep in mind that you must be careful not to allow tissues to dry out at any time.
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working.

components.data: Harvest fresh tissue and place it in a dish filled with ice-cold PBS buffer (AR0030, Boster Bio).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Harvest fresh tissue and place it in a dish filled with ice-cold PBS buffer (AR0030, Boster Bio).

components.name: Section

components.data: Wash the tissue thoroughly with PBS to remove blood. Use forceps to remove connective tissues.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the tissue thoroughly with PBS to remove blood. Use forceps to remove connective tissues.

components.data: Sample Preparation - Paraformaldehyde Cooling and Dehydration
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Sample Preparation - Paraformaldehyde Cooling and Dehydration

components.data: Cut the tissue into slices with a thickness of 3 mm or less.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Cut the tissue into slices with a thickness of 3 mm or less.

components.data: Sample Preparation - Paraformaldehyde Cooling and Dehydration
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Sample Preparation - Paraformaldehyde Cooling and Dehydration

components.data: Immerse the slices in 4% paraformaldehyde (AR1068, Boster Bio) at room temperature for 8 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Immerse the slices in 4% paraformaldehyde (AR1068, Boster Bio) at room temperature for 8 minutes.

components.data: Sample Preparation - Paraformaldehyde Cooling and Dehydration
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Sample Preparation - Paraformaldehyde Cooling and Dehydration

components.data: Immerse the slices in 4% paraformaldehyde (pre-cool at 4°C) for 6 to 7 hours. The paraformaldehyde volume should be 20X greater than the tissue volume by weight.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Immerse the slices in 4% paraformaldehyde (pre-cool at 4°C) for 6 to 7 hours. The paraformaldehyde volume should be 20X greater than the tissue volume by weight.

components.data: Sample Preparation - Paraformaldehyde Cooling and Dehydration
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Sample Preparation - Paraformaldehyde Cooling and Dehydration

components.data: Wash the tissue 3X with PBS (1 minute each).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the tissue 3X with PBS (1 minute each).

components.data: Sample Preparation - Paraformaldehyde Cooling and Dehydration
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Sample Preparation - Paraformaldehyde Cooling and Dehydration

components.data:
Dehydrate the tissue by immersing the tissue sequentially as follows:

  • 1X into 80% ethanol (1 hour at 4°C)
  • 1X into 90% ethanol (1 hour at 4°C)
  • 3X into 95% ethanol (1 hour each at 4°C)
  • 3X into 100% ethanol (1 hour each at 4°C)
  • 3X into dimethylbenzene (0.5 hr each at room temperature)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Dehydrate the tissue by immersing the tissue sequentially as follows:

  • 1X into 80% ethanol (1 hour at 4°C)
  • 1X into 90% ethanol (1 hour at 4°C)
  • 3X into 95% ethanol (1 hour each at 4°C)
  • 3X into 100% ethanol (1 hour each at 4°C)
  • 3X into dimethylbenzene (0.5 hr each at room temperature)

components.data: Sample Preparation - Liquid Paraffin Section
components.name: Section

components.data: Prepare the first portion of liquid paraffin in a suitable bath and allow the paraffin to reach and maintain at 60°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare the first portion of liquid paraffin in a suitable bath and allow the paraffin to reach and maintain at 60°C.

components.data: Sample Preparation - Liquid Paraffin Section
components.name: Section

components.data: Immerse the tissue 2X into the paraffin bath (2 hours each).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Immerse the tissue 2X into the paraffin bath (2 hours each).

components.data: Sample Preparation - Liquid Paraffin Section
components.name: Section

components.data: Prepare the second portion of liquid paraffin in a suitable bath and allow the paraffin to reach and maintain at 60°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare the second portion of liquid paraffin in a suitable bath and allow the paraffin to reach and maintain at 60°C.

components.data: Sample Preparation - Liquid Paraffin Section
components.name: Section

components.data: Pour the second portion of paraffin into a mold.

components.name: Section

components.name: Section

components.data: Incubate the tissue at room temperature until it coagulates.

components.name: Section

components.name: Section

components.data: Slice the remaining section carefully with ~5 µm thickness.
components.name: Description

components.name: Section

source_data.section: Sample Preparation - Section Slicing and Incubation

components.name: Section

components.data: Mount the tissue section onto Poly-Lysine (AR0003, Boster Bio) or APTES (AR0001, Boster Bio) coated glass slides.
components.name: Description

components.data: Incubate the slides overnight at 37°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 20 of IHC-P Protocol
source_data.annotation: This fixation procedure using paraformaldehyde and formalin fixatives may cause autofluorescence in the green spectrum. In this case, you may try fluorophores in the (i) red range or (ii) infrared range if you have an infrared detection system.
source_data.thread_text: This fixation procedure using paraformaldehyde and formalin fixatives may cause autofluorescence in the green spectrum. In this case, you may try fluorophores in the (i) red range or (ii) infrared range if you have an infrared detection system.
source_data.body: This fixation procedure using paraformaldehyde and formalin fixatives may cause autofluorescence in the green spectrum. In this case, you may try fluorophores in the (i) red range or (ii) infrared range if you have an infrared detection system.

components.data: Dewaxing/Deparaffinization
components.name: Section

components.data:
Prepare the following reagents:

  • 90% dimethylbenzene
  • 95% dimethylbenzene
  • 100% dimethylbenzene
  • 90% ethanol
  • 95% ethanol
  • 100% ethanol
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Prepare the following reagents:

  • 90% dimethylbenzene
  • 95% dimethylbenzene
  • 100% dimethylbenzene
  • 90% ethanol
  • 95% ethanol
  • 100% ethanol

components.data: Dewaxing/Deparaffinization
components.name: Section

components.data:
Sequentially immerse paraffin sections into:

  • 90% dimethylbenzene (for 7 minutes)
  • 95% dimethylbenzene (for 7 minutes)
  • 100% dimethylbenzene (for 7 minutes)
  • 90% ethanol (for 7 minutes)
  • 95% ethanol (for 7 minutes)
  • 100% ethanol (for 7 minutes)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Sequentially immerse paraffin sections into:

  • 90% dimethylbenzene (for 7 minutes)
  • 95% dimethylbenzene (for 7 minutes)
  • 100% dimethylbenzene (for 7 minutes)
  • 90% ethanol (for 7 minutes)
  • 95% ethanol (for 7 minutes)
  • 100% ethanol (for 7 minutes)

components.data: Dewaxing/Deparaffinization
components.name: Section

components.data: Wash the slides with water to remove the ethanol.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the slides with water to remove the ethanol.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 23 of IHC-P Protocol
source_data.annotation: The process of dewaxing should be done in a fume hood at room temperature in summer. When the temperature is lower than 18°C, it is recommended to dewax at 50°C.
source_data.thread_text: The process of dewaxing should be done in a fume hood at room temperature in summer. When the temperature is lower than 18°C, it is recommended to dewax at 50°C.
source_data.body: The process of dewaxing should be done in a fume hood at room temperature in summer. When the temperature is lower than 18°C, it is recommended to dewax at 50°C.

components.data: Inactivation
components.name: Section

components.data: Immerse dewaxed paraffin section into the 3% H2O2 (AR1108, Boster Bio) at room temperature for 10 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Immerse dewaxed paraffin section into the 3% H2O2 (AR1108, Boster Bio) at room temperature for 10 minutes.

components.data: Inactivation
components.name: Section

components.data: Wash the section 3X to 5X with distilled water (total 3 to 5 minutes).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the section 3X to 5X with distilled water (total 3 to 5 minutes).

components.name: Section

source_data.section: Antigen Retrieval (Heat Induced Epitope Retrieval: HIER)

components.data: Immerse the paraffin sections in citrate buffer (AR0024, Boster Bio).
components.name: Description

components.name: Section

components.data: Heat the buffer in the microwave and turn it off when the buffer has boiled.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Heat the buffer in the microwave and turn it off when the buffer has boiled.

components.name: Section

source_data.section: Antigen Retrieval (Heat Induced Epitope Retrieval: HIER)

components.data: Keep the boiled buffer in the microwave for 5 to 10 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Keep the boiled buffer in the microwave for 5 to 10 minutes.

components.data: Antigen Retrieval (Heat Induced Epitope Retrieval: HIER)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Antigen Retrieval (Heat Induced Epitope Retrieval: HIER)

components.data: Repeat the heating as outlined above for 1 to 2 times.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Repeat the heating as outlined above for 1 to 2 times.

components.name: Section

source_data.section: Antigen Retrieval (Heat Induced Epitope Retrieval: HIER)

components.data: Cool the slides until it reaches room temperature.

components.name: Section

source_data.section: Antigen Retrieval (Heat Induced Epitope Retrieval: HIER)

components.data: Wash the sections 1X to 2X with PBS.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the sections 1X to 2X with PBS.

components.data: Blocking
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 5% BSA blocking solution or normal goat serum to the HIER treated samples.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 5% BSA blocking solution or normal goat serum to the HIER treated samples.

components.data: Blocking
components.name: Section

components.data: Incubate the samples at 37°C for 30 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate the samples at 37°C for 30 minutes.

components.data: Blocking
components.name: Section

components.data: Discard extra liquid (No washing required).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Discard extra liquid (No washing required).

components.data: Primary Antibody Incubation
components.name: Section

components.data: Dilute primary antibody with antibody diluent (AR1016, Boster Bio) to the concentration recommended by the antibody manufacturer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dilute primary antibody with antibody diluent (AR1016, Boster Bio) to the concentration recommended by the antibody manufacturer.

source_data.reagent_name: Antibody Dilution Buffer With BSA, Reducing Background

components.data: Primary Antibody Incubation
components.name: Section

components.data: Add the diluted antibody to the samples and incubate overnight at 4℃ or at 37℃ for 1 hour.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add the diluted antibody to the samples and incubate overnight at 4℃ or at 37℃ for 1 hour.

components.data: Primary Antibody Incubation
components.name: Section

components.data: Wash the samples 2X with PBS (20 minutes each).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the samples 2X with PBS (20 minutes each).

components.data: Secondary Antibody Incubation
components.name: Section

components.data: Add the diluted antibody to the samples and incubate at 37°C for 30 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add the diluted antibody to the samples and incubate at 37°C for 30 minutes.

components.data: Secondary Antibody Incubation
components.name: Section

components.data: Wash the samples 2X with PBS (20 minutes each).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the samples 2X with PBS (20 minutes each).

components.data: Secondary Antibody Incubation
components.name: Section

components.data: Dilute biotinylated secondary antibody with antibody diluent (AR1016, Boster Bio) to the concentration recommended by the antibody manufacturer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dilute biotinylated secondary antibody with antibody diluent (AR1016, Boster Bio) to the concentration recommended by the antibody manufacturer.

source_data.reagent_name: Antibody Dilution Buffer With BSA, Reducing Background

components.data: Staining
components.name: Section

components.data: Add Strept-Avidin Biotin Complex (SABC) HRP-conjugated or AP-conjugated reagents to the samples.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add Strept-Avidin Biotin Complex (SABC) HRP-conjugated or AP-conjugated reagents to the samples.

components.data: https://www.bosterbio.com/catalogsearch/result/?q=sabc+hrp
components.name: External Link

components.data: https://www.bosterbio.com/catalogsearch/result/?q=sabc+alkaline+phosphatase
components.name: External Link

components.data: Staining
components.name: Section

components.data: Incubate the samples at 37°C for 30 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate the samples at 37°C for 30 minutes.

components.data: Staining
components.name: Section

components.data: Wash the samples 3X with PBS (20 minutes each).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the samples 3X with PBS (20 minutes each).

components.data: Staining
components.name: Section

components.data: Add a suitable amount of DAB reagent (AR1022, AR1025, Boster Bio) to the samples and incubate in darkness at room temperature for 10 to 30 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add a suitable amount of DAB reagent (AR1022, AR1025, Boster Bio) to the samples and incubate in darkness at room temperature for 10 to 30 minutes.

components.data: Staining
components.name: Section

components.data: Monitor the tissue staining intensity under a bright-field microscope.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Monitor the tissue staining intensity under a bright-field microscope.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 45 of IHC-P Protocol
source_data.annotation: If the staining background is too high, wash the section 4X with 0.01-0.02% TWEEN 20 PBS and 2X with pure PBS after the SABC reaction and before DAB staining. Then use DAB to stain the samples.
source_data.thread_text: If the staining background is too high, wash the section 4X with 0.01-0.02% TWEEN 20 PBS and 2X with pure PBS after the SABC reaction and before DAB staining. Then use DAB to stain the samples.
source_data.body: If the staining background is too high, wash the section 4X with 0.01-0.02% TWEEN 20 PBS and 2X with pure PBS after the SABC reaction and before DAB staining. Then use DAB to stain the samples.

components.data: Staining
components.name: Section

components.data: Wash the samples 3 to 5 times with distilled water.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the samples 3 to 5 times with distilled water.

components.data: Staining
components.name: Section

components.data:
Counterstain (if necessary)

  • Add haematoxylin (AR0005, Boster Bio) to the sample
  • Dehydrate
  • Immerse the paraffin sections 2X in dimethylbenzene (7 minutes each)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Counterstain (if necessary)

  • Add haematoxylin (AR0005, Boster Bio) to the sample
  • Dehydrate
  • Immerse the paraffin sections 2X in dimethylbenzene (7 minutes each)
